items.title: Introduction to Scheme/Racket
items.content_html: In my previous post I've introduced the new study group I recently joined with the focus on type theory and dependent types using "The Little Typer" book as a nice introduction to the subject.

items.title: Let's begin! 'The Little Typer' study group London
items.content_html: Last Tuesday, 20th November, we started a quite interesting (and really nerdy) new "study group" inside the "London Type-Driven Development Meetup": "The Little Typer Study Group".

items.title: Moving to Gitlab pages
items.content_html: Last day I've discovered, by chance, a "new" feature from Gitlab: Gitlab pages.

items.title: Introducing Blockchain to your CEO
items.content_html: In the attached post I'm sharing the slides of my talk at Blockchain-now conference. My talk was focused on trying to explain the Blockchain to not technical people. Please, don't hesitate to share your feedback.

items.title: Playing with F# and SkiaSharp on Xamarin
items.content_html: This is time I'm trying to use F# with SkiaSharp the .Net wrapper of the nice Skia Library a 2D Graphic Library from Google, in Xamarin more precisely with Xamarin Forms, a cross-platform framework to easily develop native mobile application on iOS, Android and other platforms.

items.title: My first Blockchain interview
items.content_html: A few days ago I was sharing my talk about intro to functional programming, and today, with a perfect timing, they just published my first interview about my other passion/focus nowadays: distributed (decentralised actually) systems, in particular, DLT (Distributed Ledger Technologies) got from my love for Bitcoin.

items.title: (Talk) Make functions great again
items.content_html: After some time, I came back to provide a technical talk.

items.title: Bye bye Jekyll, welcome Hakyll
items.content_html: It's always difficult to properly start something and blogging make no exceptions at all.
